name: No Contact Protocols
description: Establishing and maintaining complete disconnection from narcissistic individuals.

cards.title: The No-Contact Rule
cards.description: Understanding the necessity and mechanics of going no-contact with a narcissist.
bulletpoints: Going no-contact is the most effective way to regain control over your emotional and psychological state.
Expect withdrawal symptoms, such as self-doubt, guilt, and the urge to reconnect, as part of the detox process.
Solidify your decision by documenting all past manipulations, reminding yourself why no-contact is essential.
cards.summaryText: Go no-contact to regain control over your emotional and psychological state—it's the most effective method, expect withdrawal symptoms like self-doubt, guilt, and urges to reconnect as part of detox, and document past manipulations to remind yourself why no-contact is essential.

cards.title: Handling Flying Monkeys
cards.description: Identifying and neutralizing enablers sent by the narcissist to break your defenses.
bulletpoints: Flying monkeys act as messengers, spreading the narcissist's narrative and attempting to manipulate your emotions.
Use the Gray Rock Method to become emotionally unresponsive, providing no fuel for further manipulation.
If necessary, block, disengage, or respond with strategic deflection to minimize their influence.
cards.summaryText: Recognize flying monkeys as messengers spreading the narcissist's narrative to manipulate you, use the Gray Rock Method to become emotionally unresponsive and cut off their fuel, and block, disengage, or strategically deflect to minimize their influence.

cards.title: Information Control & Digital Boundaries
cards.description: Eliminating digital footprints and vulnerabilities narcissists exploit.
bulletpoints: Lock down social media accounts, remove mutual contacts, and set profiles to private or delete them entirely.
Change passwords, enable two-factor authentication, and use secure communication channels for critical interactions.
Avoid posting anything that reveals your emotional state, location, or future plans to prevent manipulation attempts.
cards.summaryText: Lock down social media, remove mutual contacts, and set profiles to private or delete entirely, change passwords and enable two-factor authentication for secure communication, and avoid posting emotional state, location, or plans to prevent manipulation attempts.

cards.title: Psychological Detox from Narcissistic Influence
cards.description: Rewiring your thought patterns to break free from mental conditioning imposed by the narcissist.
bulletpoints: Recognize that the narcissist's voice in your head is not your own—begin replacing it with self-affirming statements.
Detox emotionally by cutting off sources of nostalgia, such as old messages, gifts, or shared music playlists.
Engage in reprogramming techniques like affirmations, meditation, and self-validation to rebuild confidence.
cards.summaryText: Recognize the narcissist's voice in your head isn't yours and replace it with self-affirming statements, detox emotionally by cutting off nostalgia sources like old messages, gifts, or music playlists, and use reprogramming techniques like affirmations, meditation, and self-validation to rebuild confidence.

cards.title: Surviving Hoovering Attempts
cards.description: Resisting manipulative attempts to pull you back into the narcissist's control.
bulletpoints: Narcissists often return with fake apologies, promises of change, or guilt-inducing messages to re-hook you.
Recognize their tactics—love bombing, guilt trips, or feigned emergencies—and remain emotionally detached.
Prepare a response plan in advance, including automatic blocking or pre-scripted neutral replies if necessary.
cards.summaryText: Expect narcissists to return with fake apologies, promises of change, or guilt-inducing messages to re-hook you, recognize their tactics like love bombing, guilt trips, or fake emergencies and stay emotionally detached, and prepare a response plan with automatic blocking or pre-scripted neutral replies.

cards.title: Mastering the Gray Rock Method
cards.description: Becoming uninteresting and emotionally unavailable to disarm narcissistic attacks.
bulletpoints: Limit responses to short, neutral, and unemotional statements to avoid giving the narcissist any reaction.
Maintain a flat, detached demeanor, showing no excitement, frustration, or emotional engagement.
Use vague responses and minimal details when forced to interact in unavoidable situations.
cards.summaryText: Limit responses to short, neutral, unemotional statements to avoid giving reactions, maintain a flat detached demeanor with no excitement or frustration, and use vague responses with minimal details in unavoidable interactions.

cards.title: Legal Protection and Safety Planning
cards.description: Taking legal measures to protect yourself from harassment, stalking, or defamation.
bulletpoints: Document every instance of harassment, threats, or boundary violations in case legal action is needed.
Consult legal professionals for options such as restraining orders or cease-and-desist letters.
Ensure your home, workplace, and daily routines are secure to minimize potential encounters or surveillance.
cards.summaryText: Document every instance of harassment, threats, or boundary violations for potential legal action, consult legal professionals for restraining orders or cease-and-desist letters, and secure your home, workplace, and daily routines to minimize encounters or surveillance.

cards.title: Emotional Reinforcement and Resilience
cards.description: Building the inner strength to stay no-contact despite emotional triggers or loneliness.
bulletpoints: Replace the loss of the narcissistic relationship with new sources of fulfillment, such as hobbies and supportive friendships.
Remind yourself that healing is not linear—there will be setbacks, but progress happens over time.
Develop a crisis plan with affirmations, distractions, and trusted contacts to turn to during moments of weakness.
cards.summaryText: Replace the narcissistic relationship loss with new fulfillment sources like hobbies and supportive friendships, remember healing isn't linear—setbacks happen but progress comes over time, and develop a crisis plan with affirmations, distractions, and trusted contacts for weak moments.

cards.title: Detoxing from Trauma Bond Cravings
cards.description: Understanding and overcoming the addictive elements of toxic relationships.
bulletpoints: Recognize that trauma bonds create a chemical addiction to the highs and lows of the relationship.
Replace the dopamine rush of the toxic dynamic with healthier rewards, such as exercise, music, or new experiences.
Reprogram your nervous system by practicing mindfulness and grounding techniques when withdrawal symptoms arise.
cards.summaryText: Recognize trauma bonds create chemical addiction to relationship highs and lows, replace the toxic dopamine rush with healthier rewards like exercise, music, or new experiences, and reprogram your nervous system with mindfulness and grounding when withdrawal symptoms arise.

cards.title: Rebuilding Identity After Narcissistic Abuse
cards.description: Restoring self-worth and autonomy after breaking free from a manipulative relationship.
bulletpoints: Rediscover who you are outside of the narcissist's influence by exploring new interests and passions.
Affirm your sovereignty daily by reminding yourself that your value is not dependent on external validation.
Set long-term personal goals that reinforce your independence and self-trust.
cards.summaryText: Rediscover who you are outside the narcissist's influence by exploring new interests and passions, affirm your sovereignty daily by reminding yourself your value doesn't depend on external validation, and set long-term goals that reinforce independence and self-trust.
